concept.title: USE INDEX clause
concept.shortdesc: The USE INDEX clause specifies which index to use as part of the query execution. The query engine attempts to use the specified index if the index is applicable for the query.

conbody.codeblock: USE INDEX ( index-ref1 [ , index-ref2 ]* ) [ USING ( VIEW | GSI ) ]

dlentry.dd: [Required] String or expression representing the index or indexes to be used for the query.
[Optional; default is USING GSI] Specifies which index form to use.
The legacy index form, which lives on the data node.
The newer and faster Global Secondary Index form, which lives on an index node and can possibly be separate from a data node.

p.b: Example 1a: Use an existing index with GSI in a query.

conbody.p: Create an index of airlines and destination airports, and then use it in a query for flights originating in San Francisco.

p.b: Example 1b: Use an existing index with VIEW in a query.

conbody.p: The usage of VIEW is identical as that of GSI.
